The users guide is useful.
https://store.ctr-electronics.com/products/cancoder
We purchased mini power modules from Rev. The VRM from Cross the Road Electronics is another option.

Can we use all the 12v ports?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-28T23:04:04.330Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":182,"readers_count":181,"score":76.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484042,"topic_slug":"we-re-to-plug-cancoder-into","display_username":"Layton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":17356,"username":"Ian_McTavish","name":"Ian McTavish","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/b5a626/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64705,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/we-re-to-plug-cancoder-into/484042/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3495250,"name":"Mithul Balasubramanian","username":"elctrilica","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/elctrilica/{size}/264271_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-29T00:48:28.398Z","cooked":"

Any of the 12V ports would power a CANcoder and you can use ports from the PDP/PDH to power it too since those also supply the 12V needed.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-29T00:48:28.398Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":29.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484042,"topic_slug":"we-re-to-plug-cancoder-into","display_username":"Mithul Balasubramanian","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64705,"username":"LaytonK737","name":"Layton","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/aca169/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65551,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"862 Electrical Lead"},"post_url":"/t/we-re-to-plug-cancoder-into/484042/4","custom_user_title":"862 Electrical Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3495262,"name":"","username":"EmerqldWither","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emerqldwither/{size}/226176_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-29T01:09:25.751Z","cooked":"

Keep in mind that you need 4 CANCoders for swerve, but you only have bascially 2 ports. What I recommend doing is purchasing these 5-slot wago connectors and plugging 1 wire into your VRM, and the CANCoders into the other slots. We plugged ours into the 12V, 500mA port

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-29T01:09:25.751Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":76.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":484042,"topic_slug":"we-re-to-plug-cancoder-into","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06XH47DC2","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Amazon.com: WAGO 221-415 Lever-Nuts 5 Conductor Compact Connectors 10 PK : Industrial & Scientific","clicks":20}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53274,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1672 Alum | Programming/Electrical"},"post_url":"/t/we-re-to-plug-cancoder-into/484042/5","custom_user_title":"1672 Alum | Programming/Electrical","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3495307,"name":"Alex","username":"aopalka","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/f9ae1b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-29T02:20:40.548Z","cooked":"

12V 500mA ports should be the ones you plug into. From the docs.

image1054×472 16 KB

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-29T02:20:40.548Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":49.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484042,"topic_slug":"we-re-to-plug-cancoder-into","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64705,"username":"LaytonK737","name":"Layton","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/aca169/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56954,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/we-re-to-plug-cancoder-into/484042/6","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3495423,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-29T04:07:13.596Z","cooked":"
EmerqldWither:

What I recommend doing is purchasing these 5-slot wago connectors and plugging 1 wire into your VRM,

Used this as our solution last year (not off the vrm, but still). Had zero issues (paid a lot of attention to detail when wiring)

100% doing this again this year.

Be sure to put strain relief on all wires/ connections.

Please note the recommended minimum gauge wire!

Yes, there are two available types of 221. One is in the range of 24-12 AWG, and the other is in the range of 20-10 AWG. The latter won’t work for the minimum recommended wire gauge of 22 AWG for the CANcoders.
